name: Hilton Sheffield

reviews.text: The hotel is not centrally located but it is only a 10 minute walk to the main areas of the city. I stayed overnight and the hotel room was spacious and clean. The bathroom was generous but not particularly new. The lock on the room door did not work but the evening staff managed to fix it.
reviews.title: Fancy Travelodge, not a real Hilton
Not Great!
reviews.text: Breakfast was good with a wide selection of hot dishes, omlettes cooked to order, fruit and yoghurts.
A good place to stay but make sure that you get a deal as it is more like an upmarket Travel Lodge rather than luxurious Hilton.
reviews.title: OK hotel/stay - Refurbishment due!

reviews.text: We stayed in a standard double room, which was, as it says, standard. One would expect a little more from a Hilton. Reception staff on Saturday 19th May were really helpful, but the room was a little bit of a let down. The bathroom was in need of a 'makeover' to say the least. Room 222 is right next to the lift shaft, so try and avoid this one if possible (unrelenting noise)
reviews.title: Disapponating stay - not up to normal hilton standards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stay here if you need to but PLEASE do not spend £200+ on a standard room.
reviews.title: Weekend spa stay

reviews.text: There were lots of positives but a few negatives. Staff were very good but thought the price was a bit excessive and did'nt feel overall it was value for money. The only really complaint was in the dinning room at breakfast. There was plenty of choice but all of the hot food was over cooked and looked as though it had been sitting there a long time. There was a communal sticky marmalade pot and knife on the breakfast bar that you would expect in a 2 star B&B in Blackpool, this was a really shame as it let down most of the staff who worked very hard and took pride in their standard of work.
reviews.title: Just a bit disappointed

reviews.text: Cheap parking
reviews.title: Excellent base in Sheffield

reviews.text: Clean room, good shower.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.text: Good position.
reviews.title: Rating for the Living well at the Hilton

reviews.text: Nice staff
reviews.title: Cheap build quality noisy hotel

reviews.text: The hotel itself is fine, not the best Hilton that's for sure but there's nothing really wrong with it. The restaurant is another thing. I don't know if it's always as bad as it was for me but if it is I can see why there was only two people in for dinner at 7.30pm! As I was on a solo trip I decided to stay in the hotel instead of going out for something to eat. What a mistake that was. I had the smoked chicken curry soup, it was ok, not much taste although it was a little cool. Then I had the spiced lamb with rice and nan bread. I'm not joking when I say this but I'm sure they used the curry soup and put lamb instead of chicken, it tasted the same. I told the waiter that and he said I think it's different ingredients.... I think!? Give the restuarant a miss if you want something nice. If its just a bit and bed its fine.
reviews.title: The hotel is fine but avoid the restaurant, it's dire!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from Easter weekend at this hotel,purchased room only for two nights then upgraded the week before travel to include Breakfasts and dinner on one night, this was excellant value for money and the evening meal was really nice(you had £25 per person to spend on the al carte menu). breakfast was the usual excellant choice of everything you could think of so even the most picky eaters would be ok. Hotel 10 min walk at tops into city centre. we went to a concert at the Motorpoint arena which is a 10 min taxi ride away which costs £5-£6 each way.we had a room overlooking the canal which had a balconey and had the weather been nice it would have been very pleasant to sit out. would imagine it is a nice atmosphere in the summer months..The room was very nice with big comfy bed, only downside is the price of snacks at the hotel, suggest you get something to eat in the centre .
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: The hotel is in a quite location, mainly other hotels and small office blocks backing onto a canal.It is about 10 mins walk up a steep hill to city centre. Not much in immediate area such as restaurants or bars.
reviews.title: Need air conditioning

reviews.text: Found a good selection of restaurants 5 minutes away by Taxi in London road.
reviews.title: Noisy!!

reviews.text: Recommend an Italian restaurant Felicini
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel in the UK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Disappointed to find that when we arrived art 3pm (the advertised check-in time) our room was not ready (didn't they know they had diamond holders arriving?). We were given a drinks voucher (which I think we would have got anyway) to go to the bar and wait whilst our room was prepared. The receptionist did say he would come and get us when the room was ready. He didn't. Not a good start. However, the room was very nice with a view over the canal area. It's about a 5/10 minute walk to the Supertram to get to either the centre of Sheffield or Meadowhall, where entertainment, shops and restaurants are located. Good breakfast. The extra pillows we ordered in advance were in the room. Tasty and well presented chocolate cake in the room as well.
reviews.title: Not central location but good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We use Hilton Sheffield a couple of times each year when visiting family in the area. We have always found the staff to be exceptionally helpful and pleasant to deal with. The car park is very convenient and walking into town takes ten minutes.
reviews.title: Ticks most of the boxes for a 4* city hotel

reviews.text: The rooms are pleasant though the bathrooms are a little dated. That said, we have always enjoyed relaxing breaks here but last time (end of March) a function was taking place with a live band and the noise reverberated right through the hotel. I complained to reception staff three times before my husband contacted the duty manager at 11pm who did admit that the noise was loud. We were offered a change of room but, as we had already stayed there for 3 nights and were checking-out 10 hours later, it was too much trouble. The loud music completely spoiled our Saturday afternoon (the band were practising) and our Saturday evening when we were trying to relax.
reviews.title: Nice setting but average

reviews.text: I understand that functions like weddings are big money-spinners for hotels but they can completely spoil the hotel-stay of someone not part of that group.
reviews.title: Good Health Club, Great Bar!

reviews.text: Noise aside, we do like this hotel. Individual air conditioning units would be fantastic or windows that opened more than 2 inches, because the rooms get very hot.
reviews.title: 3.5/5 worked out ok - very helpful / friendly staff

description: The Hilton Sheffield hotel enjoys an ideal quayside location next to Victoria Quays, two minutes’ walk from Sheffield city center. This Sheffield hotel is 15 minutes from the M1 and 10 miles from the Peak District National Park. The hotel’s central location provides easy access to Sheffield’s main attractions like the Meadowhall shopping center and Sheffield Arena. Complimentary WIFI in public areas and 24 hour gym access for hotel guests is also available.
